@graph.name: Differential gene expression for single-cell data using pseudo-bulk counts with edgeR
@graph.description:
This workflow uses the decoupler tool in Galaxy to generate pseudobulk counts from an annotated AnnData file obtained from scRNA-seq analysis. Following the pseudobulk step, differential expression genes (DEG) are calculated using the edgeR tool. The workflow also includes data sanitation steps to ensure smooth operation of edgeR and minimizing potential issues. Additionally, a Volcano plot tool is used to visualize the results after the DEG analysis.

## Associated Tutorial

This workflows is part of the tutorial [Pseudobulk Analysis with Decoupler and EdgeR](https://training.galaxyproject.org/training-material/topics/single-cell/tutorials/pseudobulk-analysis/tutorial.html), available in the [GTN](https://training.galaxyproject.org)

## Features

* Includes [Galaxy Workflow Tests](https://training.galaxyproject.org/training-material/faqs/gtn/workflow_run_test.html)
* Includes a [Galaxy Workflow Report](https://training.galaxyproject.org/training-material/faqs/galaxy/workflows_report_view.html)
